text: Wabasha is a city in Wabasha County, Minnesota, USA. It is also the county seat.The population was 2,559 in 2020. Wabasha is located in southeastern Minnesota on the Mississippi River. Established in 1830, Wabasha is the oldest town in Minnesota. It is also the oldest continuously occupied city in the upper Mississippi River valley. Wabasha is named after chief Wa-pa-shaw of the Sioux Nation. Wabasha was the setting of the movies Grumpy Old Men and Grumpier Old Men. == References == Category:County seats in Minnesota Category:Cities in Minnesota
title: Wabasha, Minnesota
